title: Personal Details of Thousands of Border Patrol and ICE Agents Allegedly Leaked in Huge Data Breach
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-15, Reading time: 2 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.thedailybeast.com%2Fpersonal-details-of-thousands-of-border-patrol-and-ice-goons-allegedly-leaked-in-huge-data-breach%2F%3Futm_source=tldrinfosec/1/0100019bc215016d-e41c5f49-d546-4537-9bd8-f22117d9d810-000000/AHOwvZZ8Ady3L3FvMAUDf5EppVT7Nie_IoMN_wvHBNc=440
summary: Personal Details of Thousands of Border Patrol and ICE Agents Allegedly Leaked in Huge Data Breach (2 minute read) Sensitive data belonging to around 4,500 ICE and Border Patrol employees has been released by a Department of Homeland Security whistleblower. The leaked data includes names, work emails, phone numbers, roles, and some resume data. The data was leaked to the ICE List website, which stated that it would conduct a manual review to filter out certain roles before releasing the data.

The weakness lies in how the phMonitor service processes certain storage-related requests, ultimately enabling crafted data to reach a curl-based health-check script and inject extra arguments. title: Choosing a Managed Service Provider
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-15, Reading time: 5 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.ncsc.gov.uk%2Fguidance%2Fchoosing-a-managed-service-provider-msp%3Futm_source=tldrinfosec/1/0100019bc215016d-e41c5f49-d546-4537-9bd8-f22117d9d810-000000/Ibi5Eiz2qawJ3SWeWWx9uAcDI9eVwOPz3biECdO-KpM=440
summary: Choosing a Managed Service Provider (5 minute read) The UK's NCSC released a guide and checklist for small- to medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) seeking to choose a Managed Service Provider (MSP) for IT and security services. Organizations should request any certifications the MSP has, customer testimonials, and ensure the MSP communicates clearly and transparently. Organizations should also ask the MSP about their policies on patching, backups, data access, logging, and incident response.

title: OpenAI signs $10 billion Deal for Compute

summary: OpenAI signs $10 billion Deal for Compute (1 minute read) OpenAI signed a multi-year deal with Cerebras worth over $10 billion to receive 750 megawatts of compute through 2028. The partnership aims to boost inference speed for OpenAI's products.

title: Gemini introduces Personal Intelligence
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-15, Reading time: 6 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fblog.google%2Finnovation-and-ai%2Fproducts%2Fgemini-app%2Fpersonal-intelligence%2F%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/0100019bc2241607-f5a37010-6509-48ec-8b5a-649ef5c46c99-000000/1UnYsinGYVicmoyId3tFNzD-Y6YEkBN8VDMK4qeEZz0=440
summary: Gemini introduces Personal Intelligence (6 minute read) Gemini's Personal Intelligence beta, launching in the US, connects Google apps to personalize user experiences by securely linking Gmail, Photos, YouTube, and Search for tailored assistance. Users control app connections, enhancing the AI's ability to provide specific, informed responses. Privacy is prioritized, ensuring data remains secure and under user control while continuously refining functionality.

title: Airbnb poaches former Meta GenAI leader to be new technology chief
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-15, Reading time: 3 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.cnbc.com%2F2026%2F01%2F14%2Fairbnb-tech-chief-meta-ai.html%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/0100019bc2241607-f5a37010-6509-48ec-8b5a-649ef5c46c99-000000/dQezPGmWJqrdBtqSmoimX21h2Tluyn19mPqpCjdk0GM=440
summary: Airbnb poaches former Meta GenAI leader to be new technology chief (3 minute read) Airbnb appointed Ahmad Al-Dahle, former head of GenAI at Meta, as its new technology chief to enhance AI in travel and e-commerce. The company is shifting beyond short-term rentals, integrating new services, AI chatbots, and aiming to become a travel concierge. Al-Dahle's extensive experience with AI at Meta and Apple aligns with Airbnb's strategic focus on tech-driven growth.

title: Doubling Inference Speed at Character.ai
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-15, Reading time: 11 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fblog.character.ai%2Ftechnical-deep-dive-how-digitalocean-and-amd-delivered-a-2x-production-inference-performance-increase-for-character-ai%2F%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/0100019bc2241607-f5a37010-6509-48ec-8b5a-649ef5c46c99-000000/W9XxOSyBF9lugHqk2dkNToRhVk5tYqAMXyMwyyfzauQ=440
summary: Doubling Inference Speed at Character.ai (11 minute read) GPU workload tuning and hardware-level optimizations reduced latency and cost across Character.ai's systems and doubled production inference speed.

title: Understanding Manus sandbox - your cloud computer
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-15, Reading time: 7 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fmanus.im%2Fblog%2Fmanus-sandbox%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/0100019bc2241607-f5a37010-6509-48ec-8b5a-649ef5c46c99-000000/oTFfEMDNoeF34rIVqZucwYoFcsCTP55EHsgsoSB1KLw=440
summary: Understanding Manus sandbox - your cloud computer (7 minute read) Manus Sandbox is a fully isolated cloud virtual machine that runs in its own environment. Manus allocates a sandbox for each task and can execute sandboxes in parallel. Sandboxes have full capabilities, including networking, file systems, a browser, and various software tools. They can work around the clock to complete assigned tasks without consuming local resources.

title: Software Too Cheap to Meter
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-15, Reading time: 6 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fsecondthoughts.ai%2Fp%2Fsoftware-too-cheap-to-meter%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/0100019bc2241607-f5a37010-6509-48ec-8b5a-649ef5c46c99-000000/ksKtuAswLPRDRRAUyhefmxylqyjuoi6PJfckjiNIynM=440
summary: Software Too Cheap to Meter (6 minute read) AI coding agents are making software development nearly free, allowing for personalized applications tailored to individual needs. These agents, like Anthropic's Claude Code, can automate small projects that save time. While the technology is still developing, it promises rapid changes in software customization and productivity by 2026.

title: How Shopify and Google built the Universal Commerce Protocol so AI agents can transact with any merchant
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-15, Reading time: Sponsor, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fshopify.engineering%2FUCP%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/0100019bc2241607-f5a37010-6509-48ec-8b5a-649ef5c46c99-000000/PHV34F4v6KaDmu_Wk5TcKwaFUfedv_znTdURSHqNZ6k=440
summary: How Shopify and Google built the Universal Commerce Protocol (UCP) so AI agents can transact with any merchant (Sponsor) Shopify and Google co-developed an open standard for AI agents: the Universal Commerce Protocol (UCP). UCP defines the discovery and negotiation mechanisms between agent and merchant, and makes it simple for humans and agents to work together. Read more on the Shopify Engineering Blog

title: GPT-5.2-Codex is now available in the Responses API
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-15, Reading time: 2 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fthreadreaderapp.com%2Fthread%2F2011499597169115219.html%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/0100019bc2241607-f5a37010-6509-48ec-8b5a-649ef5c46c99-000000/kJbMMSPoqebDQQhv-4gDty4tos2MA8E0jw2uytYRYUc=440
summary: GPT-5.2-Codex is now available in the Responses API (2 minute read) GPT-5.2-Codex is an upgraded version of GPT-5.2 optimized for agentic coding tasks in Codex and similar environments. It supports four levels of reasoning effort settings and has a 400,000-token context window. The model costs $1.75 per million input tokens and $14.00 per million output tokens. It is now available in the Responses API.

title: Tool Search now in Claude Code
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-15, Reading time: 2 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Flinks.tldrnewsletter.com%2FQB0n8M/1/0100019bc2241607-f5a37010-6509-48ec-8b5a-649ef5c46c99-000000/DE8mrg-BN3YGHeJ3VSgXCg-mioB0VAqX_ujapgcJbS4=440
summary: Tool Search now in Claude Code (2 minute read) MCP Tool Search is now rolling out in Claude Code. The feature allows Claude Code to dynamically load tools into context. Claude Code detects when MCP tool descriptions would use more than 10% of the context, and when triggered, tools are loaded via search instead of preloaded. MCP tools will otherwise work exactly as before.

title: Ministral 3 Technical Report
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-15, Reading time: 18 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Farxiv.org%2Fpdf%2F2601.08584%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/0100019bc2241607-f5a37010-6509-48ec-8b5a-649ef5c46c99-000000/NtDOu2SFv_g-BhyM0rVNCZ3cqwDYQkknmFV2xRY-GDw=440
summary: Ministral 3 Technical Report (18 minute read) Ministral 3 is a new family of dense language models (3B, 8B, and 14B) optimized for low-resource environments, offering base, instruction-tuned, and reasoning variants. The models support image understanding and were trained using Cascade Distillation, an iterative distillation and pruning method.

title: OpenAI's hidden ChatGPT Translate tool takes on Google Translate
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-15, Reading time: 1 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.bleepingcomputer.com%2Fnews%2Fartificial-intelligence%2Fopenais-hidden-chatgpt-translate-tool-takes-on-google-translate%2F%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/0100019bc2241607-f5a37010-6509-48ec-8b5a-649ef5c46c99-000000/_QGaRfy5cnae9fbqsxmCvZtmqlCYUeCVvrs6wobIntc=440
summary: OpenAI's hidden ChatGPT Translate tool takes on Google Translate (1 minute read) OpenAI is quietly rolling out a feature called ChatGPT Translate that looks very similar to Google Translate. It is unclear which model OpenAI is using for the feature. ChatGPT Translate is free to use and doesn't require a paid account. Users can keep the conversation going after the first translation. A screenshot of the feature is available in the article.

title: Anthropic is making a huge mistake
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-15, Reading time: 1 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fgeohot.github.io%2F%2Fblog%2Fjekyll%2Fupdate%2F2026%2F01%2F15%2Fanthropic-huge-mistake.html%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/0100019bc2241607-f5a37010-6509-48ec-8b5a-649ef5c46c99-000000/bMtsDBvubNCBxz9EP-GDYNLFLcg5RQwty2uDRzMg5nk=440
summary: Anthropic is making a huge mistake (1 minute read) Anthropic blocked opencode from the Claude Code API, causing frustration among users and encouraging them to switch models. This decision risks driving users to other providers by showcasing hostility against users who don't comply with strict usage policies. Blocking opencode is seen as a first step in enforcing rigid control, potentially alienating its user base.
